description: The Unified Theory of Energy
Michael John Vera
April 20, 2020

name: Energy State Theorem
description: Energy exists in three distinct states: as Radiation, as Gravitation, and as Particulate Motion. Each of these three energy states cannot exist apart from, or without, the other states.

name: Radiation
description: Radiation is Energy extended outwardly, intended for absorption.

name: Gravitation
description: Gravitation is Energy stored within Mass; it is absorbed Radiation and it is Potential Energy.

name: Particulate Motion
description: Particulate Motion is inertial Energy affecting Mass and Gravitation while being affected by Radiation and Mass.

name: Mass Structure
description: A Mass Structure is a collection of Particles drawn together by Gravitation while held apart by Radiation and Particulate Motion.

name: Radiation Theorem
description: Radiation is absorbed and stored as Gravitation inside a Mass Structure.

name: Excess Gravitation Theorem
description: Excess Gravitation within a Mass Structure is shed as Radiation.

name: Radiation Source
description: Anything emitting Radiation is a Radiation Source.

name: Coordinate System
description: Each Radiation Source will have its own Coordinate System dictated by the total number, and therefore the total possible motion, of Particles within that Radiation Source.

name: Scale
description: Scale refers to the relative size of any Radiation Source.

name: Surface Interaction Theorem
description: Due to the interaction of Radiation with Particulate Motion, the Frequency, or Frequencies, of Radiation is limited to that of the surface of the Mass Structure from which the Radiation is emitted.

name: Radiation Frequency Theorem
description: Radiation cannot have a Frequency of zero, and will contain a subset of all possible Frequencies.

name: God
description: God is the one Radiation Source containing the set of all possible Frequencies.

name: Mass Theorem
description: Mass is made up of Particles of infinitely diminishing size which group together and break apart; which can be attracted to, or repelled by, other Particles.

name: Mass Structure
description: A Mass Structure is a specific arrangement of Particles tied together by Gravitation while held apart by Particulate Motion and Radiation.

name: Particle State Theorem
description: Particles have three states: Undergravitated, Overgravitated, and Even.

name: Surface Interaction
description: A Surface Interaction describes the remainder of the process of the storage or extraction of Energy.

name: First Degree Surface Interaction Theorem
description: A First Degree Surface Interaction is any transfer of Energy that leaves, as a remainder, one or more Particles removed from their Radiation Source.

name: Second Degree Surface Interaction Theorem
description: A Second Degree Surface Interaction is any transfer of Energy whose First Degree Interaction remainder Particles interact with the Mass Structure to form a new type of Atomic Structure at the surface.

name: Atomic Structure Theorem
description: An Atomic Structure is a subset of its overall Mass Structure.

name: Generator Definition
description: A Generator is a Mass Structure which interacts with a Radiation Source to create new Atomic Structures of a specific arrangement.

name: Third Degree Surface Interaction Theorem
description: A Third Degree Surface Interaction results in a physical change to the Mass Structure.

name: Mass Structure Theorem
description: A Mass Structure will grow to form a spherical shape, due to the restructuring of Particles, and will expel excess Gravitation as Radiation outwardly on a plane at or near its equator with higher entropy, and reclaim Radiation and Particles at its poles with lower entropy.

name: Surface Depth Definition
description: Surface Depth is the depth of saturation of Radiation into a Mass Structure.

name: Surface Depth Theorem
description: Surface Depth is proportional to the amount of Gravitation that a Mass Structure is able to store.

name: Life
description: Life is any system which utilizes the results of Surface Interactions to separate itself from the Surface of a Mass Structure.

name: Fourth Degree Surface Interaction
description: A Fourth Degree Surface Interaction includes the beginning of Life.

name: Fifth Degree Surface Interation
description: A Fifth Degree Surface Interaction is a collection or grouping of various types of specialized cells that work together to further remove itself from the Surface.

name: Memory
description: Memory is the storage of a subset of all Frequencies of Radiation as Gravitation within highly specialized cells, which can also be retrieved in a reverse process.

name: Radiation Storage Frequency Theorem
description: Radiation tends to be stored in Gravitation as a specific Frequency or set of Frequencies.

name: Radiation Retrieval Theorem
description: Radiation tends to be retrieved from its Gravitated state at the same Frequency or Frequencies in which it was stored.

name: Sixth Degree Surface Interaction
description: The Sixth Degree Surface Interaction produces the most complex organisms, which are a grouping of highly specialized groupings of cells with specialized processes available to make the best use of the results of each of the five previous Surface Interactions.

name: Anxiety Theorem
description: Anxiety is a measure of self-awareness in an organism in the Sixth Degree of Surface Interactions.

name: Synthetic Construct
description: A Synthetic Construct is an idea or concept generated as a result of advanced Surface Interactions to assist with the perception of the Surface Interactions themselves. E.g. time, straight line, black hole.
